commit_message:
[k8s] Upgrade k8s dashboard version to v2.0.0

Heapster has been deprecated for a while and the new k8s dashboard
2.0.0 version supports metrics-server now. So it's time to upgrade
the default k8s dashboard to v2.0.0.

Task: 39101
Story: 2007256

subject: Fix nova compute addition with limit
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-16 15:38:26.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/nova-cell/tasks/create_cells.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova-cell/tasks/discover_computes.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova-cell/tasks/deploy.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova-cell/tasks/get_cell_settings.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-nova-compute-scale-out-ae5245449cff216d.yaml'], 'message': "Fix nova compute addition with limit

Deploy a small cloud. Add one host to the compute group in the
inventory, and scale out:

$ kolla-ansible deploy --limit <new compute host>

The command succeeds, but creating an instance fails with the following:

    Host 'compute0' is not mapped to any cell

This happens because we only discover computes on the first host in the
cell's nova conductor group. If that host is not in the specified limit,
the discovery will not happen.

This change fixes the issue by running compute discovery when any ironic
or virtualised compute hosts are in the play batch, and delegating it to
a conductor.

Change-Id: Ie984806240d147add825ffa8446ae6ff55ca4814
Closes-Bug: #1869371
(cherry picked from commit 3af28d2151f9e3431e81e5d23e0e2a72cea2c034)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix nova compute addition with limit

Deploy a small cloud. Add one host to the compute group in the
inventory, and scale out:

$ kolla-ansible deploy --limit <new compute host>

The command succeeds, but creating an instance fails with the following:

    Host 'compute0' is not mapped to any cell

This happens because we only discover computes on the first host in the
cell's nova conductor group. If that host is not in the specified limit,
the discovery will not happen.

This change fixes the issue by running compute discovery when any ironic
or virtualised compute hosts are in the play batch, and delegating it to
a conductor.

Change-Id: Ie984806240d147add825ffa8446ae6ff55ca4814
Closes-Bug: #1869371
(cherry picked from commit 3af28d2151f9e3431e81e5d23e0e2a72cea2c034)

commit_message:
(train) manual backport of: update startup-configs with latest hashes

Make sure that right after creating/updating container startup configs,
they are updated with the right config hash if a previous deployment was
done.

It'll ensure that containers don't restart for no reason.

Patch didn't apply to If72e8359e1afe2b6c28660d9755a6a1b4a62cb50
So this is a manual backport.

Change-Id: I444f33ce463df2114ddfdbbb7712b459433f9061

subject: Split out selinux management
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-28 22:56:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Split out selinux management

Currently if you have selinux enabled on the undercloud but disable it
for the overcloud, selinux is disabled on the undercloud during the
deployment. This can be resolved by only managing the selinux setting
for the deployment target hosts rather than the all.

Change-Id: I94b81ea0b954cdba7704720a145b752fa58d4308

commit_message:
Split out selinux management

Currently if you have selinux enabled on the undercloud but disable it
for the overcloud, selinux is disabled on the undercloud during the
deployment. This can be resolved by only managing the selinux setting
for the deployment target hosts rather than the all.

Change-Id: I94b81ea0b954cdba7704720a145b752fa58d4308
Closes-Bug: #1874828
(cherry picked from commit 07106c501e9e6a8db835a260cdd11fe3945115c1)

commit_message:
Enable focal and ussuri testing for gate

This adds bundles for:

 * bionic-ussuri
 * focal-ussuri

And adds a force option of the focal-ussuri bundle as it is not yet
officially supported by Juju.

Change-Id: Ic0f82df6f1dc76cdba21f23e8b04ff9e12f32181

commit_message:
Fix py38 failures

The py38 and py36 give different values looking at source code
for one hacking test, handle both cases.

Fix dictionary changed during iteration error in validators.py with
creating a temporary list so that the dictionary can be manipulated.

commit_message:
Dependencies and tox.ini clean-up

* Remove testscenarios, it's an ancient artefact
* Replace the only usage of testtools with a simple check
* Split out doc/requirements.txt
* Clean tox.ini of unnecessary (and probably cargo-culted) stuff
* Added Pygments for syntax highlighting check

Change-Id: I9f6b03606973e1e8123165c46bef53c4ce8e2b92

commit_message:
Update share-manager behavior for shrink share operation

This patch updates the share-manager to handle with the
"ShareShrinkingPossibleDataLoss" driver exception in an appropriate way
by setting the status to "available", and sending to the user an error
message warning that the shrink operation was not completed.

Change-Id: Ie1e7fcbf116d3fd831e550aa70f02a3aa60291b8
Related-Bug: #1858328
Depends-On: Idf34a149e5a975d5fbced0ec78d102c5d90b87c6
(cherry picked from commit 7aeed39ba940b5108a2937bc37a4fab1475f8f50)

commit_message:
[devstack][ci] Move bgp setup to plugin

We currently use a legacy devstack-gate script
to create the bgp speaker, and peer required
to communicate to and from the tenant private
IPv6 networks.

Move this logic to the devstack plugin so that
we can invoke it automatically with the existing
devstack variable MANILA_SETUP_IPV6.

Change-Id: Iea90e3f04ae05e5783c3163bbf2d2dabd128c7b5

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Icfe472e76835f2e44009110ef5814f2d0f4af2e4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Ied60fa88c5a2538cdc908d119253a5296b05f816
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
image/builder/buildah: support Containerfile

In the podman/buildah world, we now support the Containerfile name to
replace the Dockerfile. The structure is the same, just the file name is
different; where instead of saying docker we say container.

Change-Id: I7eff40b7125d04eadfa92a97d7265b6ec713690a
(cherry picked from commit dd3f1828f7e0b99d59bfeb079f3ddac1eb7c7151)

subject: Check timestamp of signed EC2 token request
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-30 20:25:13.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1872737-f8e1ad3b6705b766.yaml', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_contrib_ec2_core.py', 'keystone/api/_shared/EC2_S3_Resource.py', 'keystone/conf/credential.py'], 'message': "Check timestamp of signed EC2 token request

EC2 token requests contain a signature that signs the entire request,
including the access timestamp. While the signature is checked, the
timestamp is not, and so these signed requests remain valid
indefinitely, leaving the token API vulnerable to replay attacks. This
change introduces a configurable TTL for signed token requests and
ensures that the timestamp is actually validated against it.

The check will work for either an AWS Signature v1/v2 'Timestamp'
parameter[1] or the AWS Signature v4 'X-Aws-Date' header or
parameter[2].

Although this technically adds a new feature and the default value of
the feature changes behavior, this change is required to protect
credential holders and therefore must be backported to all supported
branches.

[1] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/signature-version-2.html
[2] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/sigv4-date-handling.html

Change-Id: Idb10267338b4204b435df233c636046a1ce5711f
Closes-bug: #1872737
(cherry picked from commit ab89ea749013e7f2c46260f68504f5687763e019)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Check timestamp of signed EC2 token request

EC2 token requests contain a signature that signs the entire request,
including the access timestamp. While the signature is checked, the
timestamp is not, and so these signed requests remain valid
indefinitely, leaving the token API vulnerable to replay attacks. This
change introduces a configurable TTL for signed token requests and
ensures that the timestamp is actually validated against it.

The check will work for either an AWS Signature v1/v2 'Timestamp'
parameter[1] or the AWS Signature v4 'X-Aws-Date' header or
parameter[2].

Although this technically adds a new feature and the default value of
the feature changes behavior, this change is required to protect
credential holders and therefore must be backported to all supported
branches.

[1] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/signature-version-2.html
[2] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/sigv4-date-handling.html

Change-Id: Idb10267338b4204b435df233c636046a1ce5711f
Closes-bug: #1872737
(cherry picked from commit ab89ea749013e7f2c46260f68504f5687763e019)

commit_message:
Remove provisioned calculation on non thin provision backends

On those backends, there is no need to calculate provisioned_capacity_gb
as it is not used during the scheduling. This calculation was not
scaling properly on big environments as it implies many database
queries.

Closes-Bug: #1869712

Change-Id: Icb8947991723a2a1cc334a72276a35cf50fc1b7d
(cherry picked from commit 2c30fed486320ec5ba88f21ae3df14b14da6eb35)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support, fix docs

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Enable sphinx warnings, fix all

Change-Id: I921faba15db8657115f78b7f008145c177a6ec59

commit_message:
[Train-Only] Expose --limit, --skip-tags, and --tags in config-download.

The Mistral workflows can now consume these ansible-playbook arguments
and using them during config-download (during the deploy and update
only). Separate arguments align with the new Ansible Runner which cannot
accept any arbitrary or random argument.

This is only for Train because in Ussuri we no longer run Ansible
through Mistral. In Ussuri, all of the Ansible Runner code is in place
to allow the usage of these additional flags.

Change-Id: I2a8bcd6f8e365058d667fccb3d47625ab307b9e4
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Decompose pre-images script to separate scripts

In scope of tripleo-operators work, break down the prepare-images
script to blocks for easier management and replacement by
tripleo-operators later.
Leave whole prep-images script for backward compatibility and
usage in dev environments.

Task: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1679
Change-Id: I3a096772747f3d8c60e6f9e6ea168cdcaeedb045

commit_message:
Add Prelude for Ussuri release notes.

It should be proposed before stable/ussuri branch was created but
unfortunatelly I forgot about it.
So now, the new release notes with prelude section for Ussuri are added
just to the Ussuri branch without adding them to the master at all.

Change-Id: Icb5a6367eaa98728eb62f7fe01c95fdc05f1303d

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2020-04-15 19:00:32.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Appoint Yasufumi Ogawa as Tacker PTL

I've worked for telcom industry for 17 years as a researcher in NTT

commit_message:
Appoint Yasufumi Ogawa as Tacker PTL

Update Tacker PTL to show my candidancy.
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014044.html

I've worked for telcom industry for 17 years as a researcher in NTT
R&D division. I have an experience of maintainer for driving a
sub-project of DPDK which is introduced for realizing high-performance
connectivity between VMs and containers [1]. I've also contributed to
opendev from DPDK side by providing a plugin for the feature and making
feedbacks [2][3].

For Tacker, I've made efforts for bug fixing and reviewing to accelerate
the development for Ussuri release. We will target to refine the
implementation to comply with ESTI standard aiming to become defact, and
to cover container usecases including Kubernetes.

[1] http://git.dpdk.org/apps/spp/
[2] https://opendev.org/x/networking-spp
[3] https://www.openstack.org/summit/vancouver-2018/summit-schedule/speakers/12562

Change-Id: Ib8be004bbf1dab70f7d67c86e59564096b500295

commit_message:
Support for Dell EMC SC Volume Config

Added support for SC volume config options.
Supports both iSCSI and FC drivers.
Supports deploying multiple instances of the
cinder::backend::dellemc_sc backend
(e.g. one iscsi + one fc, multiple iscsi, etc.).

Change-Id: I2f441a9df5bda4e1c646b3259d233f760fd3e742

commit_message:
[stable-only] Pass timeout in mins to create_temp_url()

We seem to be deleting the container and object created for
tempurl before the tempurl expiry(300mins).

Also in certain deployments (possibly with high load), it has
been noticed that servers respond after the 5mins timeout.
Let's double the default timeout to 10mins.

Closes-Bug: #1872446
Change-Id: I7d25f866461f5ba16793a1509d5093f8bf366270
(cherry picked from commit e319325ed4360bf776e54cf15351dcb3b8043676)

commit_message:
container_manage: introduce create_retries and exec_retries vars

tripleo_container_manage_create_retries and
tripleo_container_manage_exec_retries (default to 60) will allow a
timeout of 10 minutes for both podman exec and podman run commands.

Indeed, some containers (db-sync or when puppet runs) can take up to 10
minute to execute and finish.

Change-Id: Iff752cd124546bdd7cf857b0dacfc7d33b9a71a6

commit_message:
Remove provisioned calculation on non thin provision backends

On those backends, there is no need to calculate provisioned_capacity_gb
as it is not used during the scheduling. This calculation was not
scaling properly on big environments as it implies many database
queries.

Closes-Bug: #1869712

Change-Id: Icb8947991723a2a1cc334a72276a35cf50fc1b7d
(cherry picked from commit 2c30fed486320ec5ba88f21ae3df14b14da6eb35)

commit_message:
fix bug in quota checking

When project quota set unlimited(-1), and user in the
project is limited to a value.Then project quota must
smaller than project usage when checking quotas, which
means the value 'overs' is not None.
In this case, even though the user not over the quota,
but they can not create share

Closes-bug: #1872872

Change-Id: Id9e2bcb5d30d2b81b0723dd296b537ac7d4519f2
(cherry picked from commit 780053968270900a1402fa0db4ae96bd16060ad4)

commit_message:
Ensure <service>_restart_bundle do not run concurrently

Now that paunch containers are run asynchronously, some
containers used for HA orchestration can run concurrently,
which triggers a deadlock and cause them to time out and
exit in error.
To overcome this concurrency deadlock, tweak the start_order
configuration of each HA service to make sure that no
<service>_restart_bundle container can be started at the same
time during a given step.

Change-Id: I9ae55101945978ea6c65d37eaa8221ed3d96a7f5
Closes-Bug: #1873893
(cherry picked from commit 690124682728f56d36701e852a899aaf8ee91940)

commit_message:
[k8s] Upgrade k8s dashboard version to v2.0.0

Heapster has been deprecated for a while and the new k8s dashboard
2.0.0 version supports metrics-server now. So it's time to upgrade
the default k8s dashboard to v2.0.0.

Task: 39101
Story: 2007256

Change-Id: I02f8cb77b472142f42ecc59a339555e60f5f38d0

subject: Create /var/log/pacemaker/pacemaker.log inside HA OCF containers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-23 05:29:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Create /var/log/pacemaker/pacemaker.log inside HA OCF containers

Currently on pcmk2.0 we seem to get the following error:

  May 21 14:02:50 controller-0 pacemaker-remoted[8]: error:
    Directory '/var/log/pacemaker' does not exist: logging to
    '/var/log/pacemaker/pacemaker.log' is disabled

Let's make sure we create that file inside the container so
pacemaker_remote can log correctly.  Note: This only affects HA
containers that have a pacemaker_remote running inside (i.e. those that
use an OCF resource agent): redis, rabbit, galera and ovn-dbs.

Change-Id: Ia4c3f185b174d5315d1facdaf174e3ad170a21e2
Closes-Bug: #1830160
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-05-23 05:29:53.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/database/redis-pacemaker-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/ovn/ovn-dbs-pacemaker-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/database/mysql-pacemaker-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-messaging-notify-pacemaker-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-messaging-pacemaker-puppet.yaml', 'deployment/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-messaging-rpc-pacemaker-puppet.yaml'], 'message': "Create /var/log/pacemaker/pacemaker.log inside HA OCF containers

Let's make sure we create that file inside the container so

use an OCF resource agent): redis, rabbit, galera and ovn-dbs.

commit_message:
Create /var/log/pacemaker/pacemaker.log inside HA OCF containers

Currently on pcmk2.0 we seem to get the following error:

  May 21 14:02:50 controller-0 pacemaker-remoted[8]: error:
    Directory '/var/log/pacemaker' does not exist: logging to
    '/var/log/pacemaker/pacemaker.log' is disabled

Let's make sure we create that file inside the container so
pacemaker_remote can log correctly.  Note: This only affects HA
containers that have a pacemaker_remote running inside (i.e. those that
use an OCF resource agent): redis, rabbit, galera and ovn-dbs.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia4c3f185b174d5315d1facdaf174e3ad170a21e2
Closes-Bug: #1830160

commit_message:
WIP Retry backup_cib()

Do not fail if backup_cib fails. Especially with remotes it might take
a bit of time to be able to access the cluster's CIB.

Change-Id: I8d6cac3fc2c74091afae8ba09a210cdbc1d93717

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2019-07-25 21:05:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[WIP] Functional test for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* Remove all the serial elements from fakelibvirt's XMLDesc(), as they
are malformed and not used by anything. They would have caused
problems in libvirt.migration's _update_serial_xml().

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo and NUMAHostInfo are built to support NUMA
nodes with different numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA
topologies. This was originally inline in
test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(), and is needed for NUMA LM func
tests, so it's moved to the base libvirt functional test class.

* Factor out _run_periodics() into the InstanceHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2019-07-26 04:49:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[WIP] Functional test for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* Remove all the serial elements from fakelibvirt's XMLDesc(), as they
are malformed and not used by anything. They would have caused
problems in libvirt.migration's _update_serial_xml().

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo and NUMAHostInfo are built to support NUMA
nodes with different numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA topologies.
This was originally inline in test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(),
and is needed for NUMA LM func tests, so it's moved to the base
libvirt functional test class. The refactor also fixes a lambda
scoping issue, see the inline comment for lambda scoping fun.

* Factor out _run_periodics() into the InstanceHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848
", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2019-07-26 20:42:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[WIP] Functional test for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They
are enough to pass existing unit tests, but would break
migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with the
broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now just
set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo and NUMAHostInfo are built to support NUMA
nodes with different numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA topologies.
This was originally inline in test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(),
and is needed for NUMA LM func tests, so it's moved to the base
libvirt functional test class. The refactor also fixes a lambda
scoping issue, see the inline comment for lambda scoping fun.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a new
ServicesHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848
", 'number': 6}, {'created': '2019-07-29 21:22:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[WIP] Functional test for NUMA live migration

Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848
", 'number': 9}, {'created': '2019-08-22 21:21:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[WIP] Functional test for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They
are enough to pass existing unit tests, but would break
migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with the
broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now just
set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo and NUMAHostInfo are built to support NUMA
nodes with different numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA topologies.
This was originally inline in test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(),
and is needed for NUMA LM func tests, so it's moved to the base
libvirt functional test class. The refactor also fixes a lambda
scoping issue, see the inline comment for lambda scoping fun.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a new
ServicesHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848

migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with the
broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now just
set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo is built to support NUMA nodes with different
numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA topologies.
This was originally inline in test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(),
and is needed for NUMA LM func tests, so it's moved to the base
libvirt functional test class. The refactor also fixes a lambda
scoping issue, see the inline comment for lambda scoping fun.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a new
ServicesHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848

and is needed for NUMA LM func tests, so it's moved to the base
libvirt functional test class. The refactor also fixes a lambda
scoping issue, see the inline comment for lambda scoping fun.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a new
ServicesHelperMixin.

", 'number': 48}, {'created': '2019-09-11 01:35:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Functional tests for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* In order to test a particular situation (details in NOTEs inline)
around saving an instance, we need to pretend that the two computes do
not have shared storage and do a block migration. We do some
monkeypatching to fake this (again, see NOTEs inline), but also add
support for creating fake instance "disks" in fakelibvirt.

* The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They
are enough to pass existing unit tests, but would break
migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with the
broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now just
set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modifiy how HostInfo is built to support NUMA nodes with different
numbers of CPUs.

* Factor out creating compute hosts with differing NUMA topologies.
This was originally inline in test_cold_migrate_with_physnet_fails(),
and is needed for NUMA LM func tests, so it's moved to the base
libvirt functional test class. The refactor also fixes a lambda
scoping issue, see the inline comment for lambda scoping fun.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a new
ServicesHelperMixin.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration

", 'number': 57}, {'created': '2019-10-24 17:35:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Functional tests for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They
  are enough to pass existing unit tests, but would break
  migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
  and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
  CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
  actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
  enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with
  the broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now
  just set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
  emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modify how HostInfo is built to support NUMA nodes with different
  numbers of CPUs.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
  NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
  ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a
  new ServicesHelperMixin.

* To support testing RPC pinning, a new StubComputeRPCAPI is added to
  the integrated helpers. It replaces the real ComputeAPI's router()
  method with a stub that uses the RPC version set by the object's
  __init__. Tests can replace a real ComputeAPI object with the Stub
  to simulate compute services and/or conductors being pinned to
  different RPC versions.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration

  just set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
  emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modify how HostInfo is built to support NUMA nodes with different
  numbers of CPUs.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
  NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
  ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a
  new ServicesHelperMixin.

* To support testing RPC pinning, a new StubComputeRPCAPI is added to
  the integrated helpers. It replaces the real ComputeAPI's router()
  method with a stub that uses the RPC version set by the object's
  __init__. Tests can replace a real ComputeAPI object with the Stub
  to simulate compute services and/or conductors being pinned to
  different RPC versions.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration

", 'number': 61}, {'created': '2020-01-17 21:22:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Functional tests for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They
  are enough to pass existing unit tests, but would break
  migration._update_serial_xml(). This patch removes unused elements,
  and makes the remaining element's presence conditional to
  CONF.serial_console.enabled being set - which is how serial consoles
  actually work. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
  enabled (like the new NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal with
  the broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past now
  just set serial_console = enabled.

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
  emulatorpin XML elements.

* Modify how HostInfo is built to support NUMA nodes with different
  numbers of CPUs.

* _run_periodics() from ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is needed in the new
  NUMA LM func test class. Since the latter cannot inherit from
  ProviderUsageBaseTestCase, _run_periodics() is factored out into a
  new ServicesHelperMixin.

* To support testing RPC pinning, a new StubComputeRPCAPI is added to
  the integrated helpers. It replaces the real ComputeAPI's router()
  method with a stub that uses the RPC version set by the object's
  __init__. Tests can replace a real ComputeAPI object with the Stub
  to simulate compute services and/or conductors being pinned to
  different RPC versions.

* In the fake_imagebackend, the image_init() method that stubs in for
  a Backend needs fake is_shared_block_storage() and
  is_file_in_instance_path() methods. Those get called indirectly from
  the _check_can_live_migrate_(source|destination) checks.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration

commit_message:
Functional tests for NUMA live migration

This patch add a functional tests for NUMA live migration. It also
adds all the previously missing scaffolding, specifically:

* Make the fakelibvirt Domain support the vcpupin, memnode and
  emulatorpin XML elements.

* To support testing RPC pinning, a new StubComputeRPCAPI is added to
  the integrated helpers. It replaces the real ComputeAPI's router()
  method with a stub that uses the RPC version set by the object's
  __init__. Tests can replace a real ComputeAPI object with the Stub
  to simulate compute services and/or conductors being pinned to
  different RPC versions.

* In the fake_imagebackend, is_shared_block_storage() gets stubbed.
  It's called indirectly from the
  _check_can_live_migrate_(source|destination) checks.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: Ia3d7351c1805d98bcb799ab0375673c7f1cb8848

subject: NUMA LM: Add func test for bug 1845146

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-08 19:36:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[WIP] NUMA LM: Add func test for bug 1845146

Bug 1845146 was caused by the update available resources periodic task
running during a small window in which the migration was in 'accepted'
but resource claims had been done. 'accepted' migrations were not
considered in progress before the fix for 1845146 merged as commit
6ec686c26b, which caused the periodic task to incorrectly free the
migration's resources from the destination. This patch adds a test
that triggers this race by wrapping around the compute manager's
_do_live_migration() (which sets the 'preparing' migration status) and
running the update available resources periodic task while the
migration is still in 'accepted'.

Related bug: 1845146

Change-Id: I78e79112a9c803fb45d828cfb4641456da66364a
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2019-10-09 18:16:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "NUMA LM: Add func test for bug 1845146

Bug 1845146 was caused by the update available resources periodic task
running during a small window in which the migration was in 'accepted'
but resource claims had been done. 'accepted' migrations were not
considered in progress before the fix for 1845146 merged as commit
6ec686c26b, which caused the periodic task to incorrectly free the
migration's resources from the destination. This patch adds a test
that triggers this race by wrapping around the compute manager's
live_migration() (which sets the 'queued' migration status - this was
actually wrong in 6ec686c26b, as it talks about 'preparing') and
running the update available resources periodic task while the
migration is still in 'accepted'.

Related bug: 1845146

that triggers this race by wrapping around the compute manager's
live_migration() (which sets the 'queued' migration status - this was
actually wrong in 6ec686c26b, as it talks about 'preparing') and
running the update available resources periodic task while the
migration is still in 'accepted'.

Related bug: 1845146

commit_message:
NUMA LM: Add func test for bug 1845146

Bug 1845146 was caused by the update available resources periodic task
running during a small window in which the migration was in 'accepted'
but resource claims had been done. 'accepted' migrations were not
considered in progress before the fix for 1845146 merged as commit
6ec686c26b, which caused the periodic task to incorrectly free the
migration's resources from the destination. This patch adds a test
that triggers this race by wrapping around the compute manager's
live_migration() (which sets the 'queued' migration status - this was
actually wrong in 6ec686c26b, as it talks about 'preparing') and
running the update available resources periodic task while the
migration is still in 'accepted'.

Related bug: 1845146

Change-Id: I78e79112a9c803fb45d828cfb4641456da66364a

commit_message:
Skip rescue BFV instance tests

Nova implemented the feature for rescuing the BFV instances.
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/virt-bfv-instance-rescue.html

It is not working with ceph backend as new tests added in Tempest are failing ceph job

Related-Bug: #1876330

[{'created': '2020-04-29 00:32:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[devstack][ci] Disable firewall in plugin

We currently use a legacy devstack-gate script
to disable firewall on NFS ports; however,
anyone that installs devstack with LVM, Container,
ZFSOnLinux, CephFS-NFS drivers will need these
firewall ports to be opened to be able to mount

turned off by default. It can be invoked by setting

localrc.

commit_message:
[devstack][ci] Modify firewall in ds-plugin

To set up some first party backends such as
ZFSOnLinux, CephFS via NFS gateway, Container
(where the NAS server is containerized) and LVM,
manila's devstack plugin creates a NAS server
on the devstack host.

On test machines, access to this NAS server is
firewalled from networks outside of the host's
internal network namespace (including from private
project networks that are in different network
namespaces, on the same devstack host).

We currently use a legacy devstack-gate script
to disable firewall on NFS ports; however,
anyone that installs devstack with LVM, Container,
ZFSOnLinux, CephFS-NFS drivers will need these
firewall ports to be opened to be able to mount
shares exported off their devstack host machines.

Move these firewall commands to the devstack plugin.
These commands can be invoked by setting the localrc
variable MANILA_ALLOW_NAS_SERVER_PORTS_ON_HOST to True.
The value of this variable is False by default,
to preserve existing behavior.

Change-Id: Ic9cad47662f1edf2e5c710dbe64d580bc5f01d44

commit_message:
WIP Enable stonith at step2

In the past when every openstack service was controlled by pacemaker
enabling stonith right away was a bit risky as it might have triggered
stonith actions in case of issues. This should not really be the case
anymore since we manage only a handful of services via pacemaker.

Change-Id: I93f05f44e884baf45980af32045101ec04dd6175

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-24 15:50:51.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/nova/nova-api-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': "WIP disable nova_api rabbitmq heartbeats

nova api's use of eventlet and wsgi makes the heartbeat thread a
greenthread which does not get scheduled enough and so nova api +
rabbitmq log a lot of heartbeat connection missed errors. For now we
disable this only for nova_api and we solely rely on our tcp keepalive
settings for connection aliveness towards rabbitmq.

WIP just a placeholder for now, as we need to smoketest this and add
proper bugs/explanation

Change-Id: I0afddc38774a2c3debc5aed821409f3f44ed8c84
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
WIP disable nova_api rabbitmq heartbeats

nova api's use of eventlet and wsgi makes the heartbeat thread a
greenthread which does not get scheduled enough and so nova api +
rabbitmq log a lot of heartbeat connection missed errors. For now we
disable this only for nova_api and we solely rely on our tcp keepalive
settings for connection aliveness towards rabbitmq.

WIP just a placeholder for now, as we need to smoketest this and add
proper bugs/explanation

Change-Id: I0afddc38774a2c3debc5aed821409f3f44ed8c84

commit_message:
Add openvswitch into to_remove/to_install Leapp files.

Queens uses openvswitch2.11, while Train works on openvswitch2.13. We require leapp
to do the versions switch during the operating system upgrade so we leverage from
the reboot taking place during the operating system upgrade to change from ovs2.11
to ovs2.13.

If not done, the very first packages update will fail as ovs2.11 is mutually exclusive
with ovs2.13.

Change-Id: I5e9248a5eddf2c17625926f74398528a40d3f49c

subject: docs: Mention other ways of escaping '$'
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-01 15:11:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "docs: Mention other ways of escaping '$'

oslo config code treat treats the '$' as a special character and it
needs to be delimited when using within a string. There are two ways of
doing this, '$$' or '\$'. We document the former but not the latter. Fix
this.

Change-Id: I37cdf31ba1c2924779a46b1a2eeabb66c46a2212
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
docs: Mention other ways of escaping '$'

oslo config code treat treats the '$' as a special character and it
needs to be delimited when using within a string. There are two ways of
doing this, '$$' or '\$'. We document the former but not the latter. Fix
this.

Change-Id: I37cdf31ba1c2924779a46b1a2eeabb66c46a2212
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1872839

subject: Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-23 14:55:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

This patch continues https://review.opendev.org/#/c/633070/.

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: Ic3f7cd5733b7a28acc74345e7faa182ebd3a69b0
Closes-Bug: #1873305
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2020-04-30 04:22:52.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/schema/ovn_northbound/commands.py'], 'message': "Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: Ic3f7cd5733b7a28acc74345e7faa182ebd3a69b0
Closes-Bug: #1873305
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

This patch continues https://review.opendev.org/#/c/633070/.

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: Ic3f7cd5733b7a28acc74345e7faa182ebd3a69b0
Closes-Bug: #1873305

commit_message:
Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

This patch continues https://review.opendev.org/#/c/633070/.

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: Ic3f7cd5733b7a28acc74345e7faa182ebd3a69b0
Closes-Bug: #1873305

commit_message:
Add contributor doc policy

This is the first step of completing the contributor doc goal[0] from
the Ussuri cycle. It adds a contributing.rst policy which uses the
cookiecutter template created for the goal.

The expectation is that this is a central location for all of this
information, and the contributing.rst in each Oslo project will
simply refer to it so we aren't maintaining it in 40+ repos.

0: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/project-ptl-and-contrib-docs.html

Change-Id: I3347d553b50a52ae96186e60b729360b159d8df5

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I065a146c0041386ddc14d3cb07fa4510f8af5650

commit_message:
Add lock per share for cinder nfs mount/umount

With cinder configured as glance store and nfs as cinder backend,
if we create multiple images concurrently into the same share,
there might be race conditions.
This patch ensures a lock per export to avoid the race conditions.

This patch also introduces a reference counting mechamism for unmounting
which will unmount the share if no active thread/process is using it.

Closes-Bug: #1870289

Change-Id: I9197f64e29a0ae2e0a58186f1a70aa134f7f1db6

commit_message:
Add Prelude for Ussuri release notes.

It should be proposed before stable/ussuri branch was created but
unfortunatelly I forgot about it.
So now, the new release notes with prelude section for Ussuri is added
to the master branch and added to be ignored in Victoria's release
notes.
This patch will also be cherry-picked to the stable/ussuri branch so it
will be displayed in Ussuri's release notes properly.

Change-Id: I425167223a4136be9d12bac16f20104a1bbe4595

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I225073b4f1c4efc2b70e618c16916296a9640d0f

commit_message:
Don't override default verbose_level

In I35b10d48344c8b7f71186bc529a300f75d7b8d63, we changed to
use verbose_level for playbook verbosity and as result forced
the default client verbosity to 0 and we don't see stack
events like before. This resets it back to 1.

Change-Id: Ibcd15e78aa52cbbc29e7213c04ae63594e2bcc35

subject: WIP Make sure we chown on-disk state folders for cinder/manila via kolla_start
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 21129, 'name': 'Alan Bishop', 'email': 'abishop@redhat.com', 'username': 'ASBishop'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 07:06:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP Rerun the init_log for cinder/manila every time and also chown state folder

Via 'I9b32890717d7ddebcc282736bee60360834930d4' (cinder-* bundles and
manila-share to not need to be run as root) we want to drop the root
user from those pacemaker bundles. In order to be able to do so we need
to make sure that both log folders *and* on-disk state folders are
chowned to the right user. By doing this we have the following
scenarios:
1) New deploy and bundles running as root
Same as today, bundles run as root and the ownership of logs and state
files is non-root at the start of the deploy but is going to change to
root once the bundle starts.
2) Re-deploy and bundles running as root
Same as new deploy, the *_init_state containers will do the chown to
the non-root user, but then the bundles will just write as user like
before.
3) New deploy and bundles running as non-root
Same as today, except bundles run as non-root and the files will stay
the same
4) Re-deploy and bundles running as non-root
The *_init_state paunch containers will chown files to non-root and
when the bundles restart (due to the change in bundle definition) they
will start as non-root user and the files should be non-root

WIP because we need to discuss this in more detail and because I do
wonder about the following scenario around 4):
4.A) The *_init_state container runs and logs and on-disk state are
chown to non-root
4.B) The bundle gets restarted due to non-root user change, but while
     stopping the service writes some state/logs and closes the files
     as root.
4.C) The bundle starts as non-root, but if the files are now owned by
     root (due to closing via 4.B), things will break

Change-Id: Ia8a87b7dad3b0c2932d8f770d5d76842609a377f
Partial-Bug: #1781534

commit_message:
WIP Make sure we chown on-disk state folders for cinder/manila via kolla_start

Via 'I9b32890717d7ddebcc282736bee60360834930d4' (cinder-* bundles and
manila-share do not need to be run as root) we want to drop the root
user from those pacemaker bundles. In order to be able to do so we need
to make sure that both log folders *and* on-disk state folders are
chowned to the right user. By doing this we have the following
scenarios:
1) New deploy and bundles running as root
Same as today, bundles run as root and the ownership of logs and state
files is non-root at the start of the deploy but is going to change to
root once the bundle starts.
2) Re-deploy and bundles running as root
Same as new deploy, the *_init_state containers will do the chown to
the non-root user, but then the bundles will just write as user like
before.
3) New deploy and bundles running as non-root
Same as today, except bundles run as non-root and the files will stay
the same
4) Re-deploy and bundles running as non-root
The *_init_state paunch containers will chown files to non-root and
when the bundles restart (due to the change in bundle definition) they
will start as non-root user and the files should be non-root

We set permissions via the kolla_start mechanism so that there are no
races around changing the permissions and restarting the bundles.

WIP because we need to discuss this a bit more in detail

Change-Id: Ia8a87b7dad3b0c2932d8f770d5d76842609a377f
Partial-Bug: #1781534

subject: WIP Lower case entries in /etc/hosts
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-04 13:56:07.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/hosts-config.sh'], 'message': "WIP Lower case entries in /etc/hosts

It seems at least some components have a hard time dealing
with mixed case /etc/hosts entries. Seen in neutron for example:
2018-08-04 13:01:10.235 122238 ERROR oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit [req-b6157f9f-faf9-4a18-99ad-5d36d1371713 - - - - -] [f6f92ad8-7a93-4a70-aab3-6720a5eb20d] AMQP server on test-controller-1.internalapi.localdomain:5672 is unreachable: [Errno -2] No address found. Trying again in 1 seconds. Client port: None gaierror: [Errno -2] No address found

The hostname was test-controller-0.localdomain and the entry in
/etc/hosts was the following:
172.17.1.18 TEST-controller-0.internalapi.localdomain TEST-controller-0.internalapi

Let's lowercase all entries in any case.

Reported-By: Marian Krcmari <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

WIP: because we'd first like to fix the libraries that are not able to

Change-Id: I69474134facbfaa7ca77aab7b98c8a3f4dc83e6a

commit_message:
WIP Lower case entries in /etc/hosts

It seems at least some components have a hard time dealing
with mixed case /etc/hosts entries. Seen in neutron for example:
2018-08-04 13:01:10.235 122238 ERROR oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit [req-b6157f9f-faf9-4a18-99ad-5d36d1371713 - - - - -] [f6f92ad8-7a93-4a70-aab3-6720a5eb20d] AMQP server on test-controller-1.internalapi.localdomain:5672 is unreachable: [Errno -2] No address found. Trying again in 1 seconds. Client port: None gaierror: [Errno -2] No address found

The hostname was test-controller-0.localdomain and the entry in
/etc/hosts was the following:
172.17.1.18 TEST-controller-0.internalapi.localdomain TEST-controller-0.internalapi

Let's lowercase all entries in any case.

Reported-By: Marian Krcmari <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

WIP: because we'd first like to fix the libraries that are not able to
cope with this mixed casing

Change-Id: I69474134facbfaa7ca77aab7b98c8a3f4dc83e6a

subject: Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-23 14:55:17.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/schema/ovn_northbound/commands.py'], 'message': "Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

This patch continues https://review.opendev.org/#/c/633070/.

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: Ic3f7cd5733b7a28acc74345e7faa182ebd3a69b0
Closes-Bug: #1873305
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

This patch continues https://review.opendev.org/#/c/633070/.

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: Ic3f7cd5733b7a28acc74345e7faa182ebd3a69b0
Closes-Bug: #1873305

commit_message:
Update container certificate

Due to the bind-mounting of the actual PEM file rather than the directory
we cannot simply copy the new file to the location on the host, we need to
copy the updated PEM into the container.  This patch also removes outdated
and no longer working container detection code that was preventing any of
the tasks from ever running.

RHBZ: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1765839

Change-Id: Ie275001aabe16241d2036d39fce294f86f88e7c8
Closes-Bug: 1875746

commit_message:
Fix configure-vm.py and xml file for centos8

Fixing configure-vm script and vm.xml with this patch because for
latest OS like centos8 - older python version and older qemu machine
type is causing issue.

* For configure-vm.py - Replacing python with python3 in environment
path as python3 is the default in many latest OS.

* For vm.xml - Replacing Machine type from pc-1.0 to pc.
- pc-1.0 is old and unsupported machine type for Centos8
- Moving machine type from pc-1.0 to pc will help as pc have alias to
supported qemu machine type

Related-Bug: #1875681
Change-Id: Icd7e98ceb8859f730a32981a150f2730bde9836b

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix share shrink error status

This patch fixes the error raised by NetApp driver when the user try
to shrink a share to a size smaller than the current used space. Now
the driver raises "shrinking_possible_data_loss" instead of
"shrinking_error".

Change-Id: I01a549a0e299ae0d0d9b603a9d0797f16f4b68b3
Closes-Bug: #1858328
(cherry picked from commit c169902d41ef2b70ce1c1181408bc0916a7ea319)

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix share replica failing for 'transfer in progress' error

This patch fix an issue in NetApp driver share replica periodic
check that erroneuouly set a share replica to error after receiving
a 'Another transfer is in progress' error. The driver now skips the
resync operation for all expected transfer in progress relationship
status.

Closes-Bug: #1848889
Change-Id: If82aaa184db84660389f82654279f3c5b238fd51
(cherry picked from commit 572be43bb03a67376b52a11c70e587eb160b68a3)
(cherry picked from commit cc2dea14a514ad1a7025d904074307817c60e3ce)
(cherry picked from commit 48f3e09d12f38084a16309360fd2fbdddd441c4f)

commit_message:
WIP Keep hash of config of previous run around

This is useful in deployment_tasks to detect if the config has changed
compared to the previous run and it avoids having to look for that
info in podman inspect.

Change-Id: Ie16f42138d039e43df517467532aaa58f0b5f1db
Related-Bug: #1863442

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie13f0c75090d707a60d9b886d436bbbcd07066a5

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Id27c5ad8a9d4a00f37d4a3ff7f8a71780df50fb0
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I3548e78806a925c95641f9de355edd12971ea620
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Pin sh library used for molecule tests

This pin works for python2 and python3 environments
and resolves:

https://github.com/ansible-community/molecule/issues/2676

We unfortunately have molecule pinned, so we won't
inherit any fixes (including this one) from newer

commit_message:
compute: Add stable device rescue tests with BFV instances

This change introduces tests for stable device rescue with boot from
volume instances using blank, image and snapshot based volumes.

commit_message:
Adapt to Octavia Certificate Configuration Guide.

This patch updates the octavia controller deployment to use the
latest octavia certificate configuration guide [1]. The dual CA changes
were introduced in Train.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/octavia/latest/admin/guides/certificates.html

Change-Id: If89ec0d631568db70690f1a69d00115c59abe678
Closes-Bug: #1862133
(cherry picked from commit e84c968ed21764fd8859d369c2aa50bd10ef0937)

subject: Lowercase ironic driver hash ring and ignore case in cache
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 17685, 'name': 'Elod Illes', 'email': 'elod.illes@est.tech', 'username': 'elod.illes'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}, {'_account_id': 29963, 'name': 'Intel_Zuul', 'display_name': 'Intel Corporation CI', 'email': 'intel-openstack-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'Intel_Zuul'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 22:51:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Lowercase ironic driver hash ring and ignore case in cache

Recently we had a customer case where attempts to add new ironic nodes
to an existing undercloud resulted in half of the nodes failing to be
detected and added to nova. Ironic API returned all of the newly added
nodes when called by the driver, but half of the nodes were not
returned to the compute manager by the driver.

There was only one nova-compute service managing all of the ironic
nodes of the all-in-one typical undercloud deployment.

After days of investigation and examination of a database dump from the
customer, we noticed that at some point the customer had changed the
hostname of the machine from something containing uppercase letters to
the same name but all lowercase. The nova-compute service record had
the mixed case name and the CONF.host (socket.gethostname()) had the
lowercase name.

The hash ring logic adds all of the nova-compute service hostnames plus
CONF.host to hash ring, then the ironic driver reports only the nodes
it owns by retrieving a service hostname from the ring based on a hash
of each ironic node UUID.

Because of the machine hostname change, the hash ring contained, for
example: {'MachineHostName', 'machinehostname'} when it should have
contained only one hostname. And because the hash ring contained two
hostnames, the driver was able to retrieve only half of the nodes as
nodes that it owned. So half of the new nodes were excluded and not
added as new compute nodes.

This adds lowercasing of hosts that are added to the hash ring and
ignores case when comparing the CONF.host to the hash ring members
to avoid unnecessary pain and confusion for users that make hostname
changes that are otherwise functionally harmless.

This also adds logging of the set of hash ring members at level DEBUG
to help enable easier debugging of hash ring related situations.

Closes-Bug: #1866380

 Conflicts:
	nova/virt/ironic/driver.py

NOTE(melwitt): Conflict is because change
I1b184ff37948dc403fe38874613cd4d870c644fd is not in Rocky.

Change-Id: I617fd59de327de05a198f12b75a381f21945afb0
(cherry picked from commit 7145100ee4e732caa532d614e2149ef2a545287a)
(cherry picked from commit 588b0484bf6f5fe41514f1428aeaf5613635e35a)
(cherry picked from commit 8f8667a8dd0e453eaef8f75a3fff25db62d4cc17)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Lowercase ironic driver hash ring and ignore case in cache

Recently we had a customer case where attempts to add new ironic nodes
to an existing undercloud resulted in half of the nodes failing to be
detected and added to nova. Ironic API returned all of the newly added
nodes when called by the driver, but half of the nodes were not
returned to the compute manager by the driver.

There was only one nova-compute service managing all of the ironic
nodes of the all-in-one typical undercloud deployment.

After days of investigation and examination of a database dump from the
customer, we noticed that at some point the customer had changed the
hostname of the machine from something containing uppercase letters to
the same name but all lowercase. The nova-compute service record had
the mixed case name and the CONF.host (socket.gethostname()) had the
lowercase name.

The hash ring logic adds all of the nova-compute service hostnames plus
CONF.host to hash ring, then the ironic driver reports only the nodes
it owns by retrieving a service hostname from the ring based on a hash
of each ironic node UUID.

Because of the machine hostname change, the hash ring contained, for
example: {'MachineHostName', 'machinehostname'} when it should have
contained only one hostname. And because the hash ring contained two
hostnames, the driver was able to retrieve only half of the nodes as
nodes that it owned. So half of the new nodes were excluded and not
added as new compute nodes.

This adds lowercasing of hosts that are added to the hash ring and
ignores case when comparing the CONF.host to the hash ring members
to avoid unnecessary pain and confusion for users that make hostname
changes that are otherwise functionally harmless.

This also adds logging of the set of hash ring members at level DEBUG
to help enable easier debugging of hash ring related situations.

Closes-Bug: #1866380

 Conflicts:
	nova/virt/ironic/driver.py

NOTE(melwitt): Conflict is because change
I1b184ff37948dc403fe38874613cd4d870c644fd is not in Rocky.

Change-Id: I617fd59de327de05a198f12b75a381f21945afb0
(cherry picked from commit 7145100ee4e732caa532d614e2149ef2a545287a)
(cherry picked from commit 588b0484bf6f5fe41514f1428aeaf5613635e35a)
(cherry picked from commit 8f8667a8dd0e453eaef8f75a3fff25db62d4cc17)

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

horizon recently switched from the third-party mock to unittest.mock.
This breaks heat-dashboard unit tests somehow.
We no longer support py27 and we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module. Rather than investigating the cause of
the failure, it would be nice to switch to unittest.mock.

horizon dependency is updated to 18.3.1 as unittest.mock is used
since 18.3.0 and 18.3.0 has an issue that it always requires pytest.
lower-constraints is updated to match horizon requirements.

hacking local-check-factory is disabled temporarily due to
the incompatibility with hacking 2.0 or later.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715690/ will recover it.

Change-Id: I517d6d7d36410c64bf48ad958b3e2115725a6491
(cherry picked from commit bd68639408372c938766bc53c6cc305b8a9743ce)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-15 12:04:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Parametrize patch strip option in workarounds.

Right now, all the workarounds are patched using the strip option
--p set to 1. That works in most of the cases, but for some directories
/projects it's needed to pass a different strip value (tripleo-ansible)
causing all workarounds to not been applied.

This patch adds a new workarounds option patch_strip which accepts an
integer and will set the -p option at the time of applying the workaround.
If the option is not passed, the default value will be 1.

Change-Id: I0cb5d26838cf38bb04e22cfa3a06e06177eebd55
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2020-04-15 13:17:31.000000000', 'files': ['templates/workarounds.sh.j2', 'tests/workarounds-upgrade', 'tests/workarounds-update'], 'message': "Parametrize patch strip option in workarounds.

Change-Id: I0cb5d26838cf38bb04e22cfa3a06e06177eebd55

commit_message:
Parametrize patch strip option in workarounds.

Right now, all the workarounds are patched using the strip option
--p set to 1. That works in most of the cases, but for some directories
/projects it's needed to pass a different strip value (tripleo-ansible)
causing all workarounds to not been applied.

This patch adds a new workarounds option patch_strip which accepts an
integer and will set the -p option at the time of applying the workaround.
If the option is not passed, the default value will be 1.

Change-Id: I0cb5d26838cf38bb04e22cfa3a06e06177eebd55

commit_message:
[Community goal] Update contributor documentation

As the Ussuri goal we have an OpenStack project wide contributing
documentation template [1]. os-vif use its own bug or feature
tracking LP and core team is also not exactly same as nova so adding
its own contributor guide with keeping common links from nova
with os-vif specific information.

Also the top level CONTRIBUTING.rst template has been changed in the
cookiecutter repo[2]. So this patch updates the CONTRIBUTING.rst according
to the new template.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/cookiecutter/src/branch/master/%7b%7bcookiecutter.repo_name%7d%7d/$
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696001

Change-Id: I6017fdbb403d4cd90f4c3c2bd4a197dfbb67f6ec
Story: #2007236
Task: #38541

commit_message:
Add support for encrypting Horizon and Placement API

This patch introduces an optional backend encryption for Horizon and
Placement services. When used in conjunction with enabling TLS for
service API endpoints, network communcation will be encrypted end to
end, from client through HAProxy to the Horizon and Placement services.

Change-Id: I9cb274141c95aea20e733baa623da071b30acf2d
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3456e8fd7e3a24d4dd60454f11c934232fe399cf

', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2020-04-15 16:30:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "FFWD automation for HA and composable environments

We need to run in quite tedious order to upgrade properly
the Pacemaker managed roles. First we split the environment
into Pacemaker enabled, Non-Pacemaker Non-Compute and Compute
groups of roles:

Pacemaker: ['Controller','Database','Messaging']
Non-Pacemaker&Non-Compute: ['Ceph','Networking','Objectstorage']
Compute: ['Compute','OSDCompute']

For Pacemaker we have to upgrade one of each roles in the Pacemaker
group together - controller-0,database-0,messaging-0 to ensure that
upgrade will work. We can run system upgrade in parallel on them
too.

The tricky part with Pacemaker is that than we need to run upgrade
on the one node of each role in the Pacemaker group but also on all
previous Pacemaker nodes to ensure we don't create several separated
clusters.

For the rest it's simply faster to run for each role in the group.

Change-Id: I65b3f3f45f975be90438b3cdc3c8e24cd290d0a8

commit_message:
FFWD automation for HA and composable environments

We need to run in quite tedious order to upgrade properly
the Pacemaker managed roles. First we split the environment
into Pacemaker enabled, Non-Pacemaker Non-Compute and Compute
groups of roles:

Pacemaker: ['Controller','Database','Messaging']
Non-Pacemaker&Non-Compute: ['Ceph','Networking','Objectstorage']
Compute: ['Compute','OSDCompute']

For Pacemaker we have to upgrade one of each roles in the Pacemaker
group together - controller-0,database-0,messaging-0 to ensure that
upgrade will work. We can run system upgrade in parallel on them
too.

The tricky part with Pacemaker is that than we need to run upgrade
on the one node of each role in the Pacemaker group but also on all
previous Pacemaker nodes to ensure we don't create several separated
clusters.

For the rest it's simply faster to run for each role in the group.

Change-Id: I65b3f3f45f975be90438b3cdc3c8e24cd290d0a8

commit_message:
Simplify ffwd2 CIP stein parameters.

Currently, the ContainerImagePrepare parameters required for FFWD2
to work are harcoded in the defaults/main.yaml. However, the
namespace_stein variable, should point at the same value the namespace
variable points. This patch simplifies a little the logic, adds a new
fact full_namespace that stores the content of the namespace field from
the containers-prepare-parameters.yaml file and assigns the namespace_stein
key to it.

Change-Id: I07967e0590aee9c86a6427469914f65fbdb3929d

commit_message:
Build enablerepo options automatically for leapp when not subsribed.

A new option added into leapp lets us configure a set of repositories to run
leapp with. This new option is compatible with rhos-release, removing the need
for an special leapp actor.
This patch checks the rhos-release repos configured locally in the Undercloud
and builds a --enablerepo string with all the repos obtained. This string is
then passed at the time of running leapp, if the machine isn't using a
subscription.

This patch also cleans up some unnecessary code to handle differente leapp
versions, as our CI now works with latest leapp version. As well as some
unsupported Leapp environment variables [0].

[0]-https://github.com/oamg/leapp/blob/69f3f8c21dae5fbe270701e5728b8e2512faddb6/docs/source/el7toel8/envars.md

Change-Id: Ife2734547c4c981dece0c0f9b436eb10e99dd1b1

commit_message:
Clean up zuul jobs

Individual jobs that are included in a job template were individually
defined in each queue to pull in the nova repo, but this is not needed
for running unit tests.

This removes the individual jobs so only the template defined ones are
run. It also gets rid of the openstack-tox-lower-constraints job in
favor of using the openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template.

Change-Id: Iee4ce1612d2a38585b7c5db8db71b1619216a1fa
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-28 14:59:57.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I80d575844076899a7f2bd5e3cc4df67d70287915
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I80d575844076899a7f2bd5e3cc4df67d70287915

commit_message:
Allow artcl to be run by Zuul

- Avoid implicit use of lookup env which breaks under Zuul CI
- Add Zuul job that tests direct role usage and avoids regression.
  Follows layout used by zuul-jobs repository.

Change-Id: I1cdd31bfc28131a77a1596b87d081957c9089550
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/1458
