", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2020-04-27 16:09:41.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/agent_client.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent_base.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/agent_base.py'], 'message': "Don't break UEFI install with older IPAs

For Software RAID, we need to pass the boot mode to the IPA via a new
parameter. In case the IPA does not understand this new parameter yet,
we catch the error and fail for UEFI. This patch proposes to only fail
in the case of software RAID, since the older IPA can handle the general

Change-Id: Id6b51dd19e83d20dc8d6d312cbec12d09bfd76c1
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Don't break UEFI install with older IPAs

For Software RAID, we need to pass the boot mode to the IPA via a new
parameter. In case the IPA does not understand this new parameter yet,
we catch the error and fail for UEFI. This patch proposes to only fail
in the case of software RAID, since the older IPA can handle the general
case of UEFIi, e.g. with a whole disk image.

Change-Id: Id6b51dd19e83d20dc8d6d312cbec12d09bfd76c1

commit_message:
[stable-only] Add retry for inserting temp_ssh_key

For slow nodes, we don't wait for node to boot completely after the
heat stack is CREATE/UPDATE_COMPLETE. This would ensure we try a
few times before failing.

Adds tenacity to requirements and bumps lower-constraints.

Change-Id: Iee8f3200a3c108375c7ca296734db1a51914cd69
Closes-Bug: #1873892

commit_message:
Upgrade flake8-import-order version to 0.17.1

Full py3 compatible version.
Add all Python3 modules to stdlib list.
Also includes fix to an enum34 dependency bug.

This requires pointing the hash for the functional test to a newer
commit in ironic-inspector repo, and adjusting the functional
test to take into consideration the added scope to the
introspection rules.

Change-Id: Ifa42ffaf97d6e2651b305374c216937ae276e8b7

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Icdf6f01aaefd12f31f1046f527a99b0021fbd39a

commit_message:
Fix spurious test failure

idlutils.wait_for_change can be called several times depending on
what happens w/ the thread starting. Just test that it is called at
least one time with the correct arguments.

commit_message:
[Ceph-OSD] Update getting and releasing of lock

The PS moves the relese of lock out from the if-else statement.
Otherwise we are not releasing the lock in two of three cases.
And the lock will be released only if we are going though
the last "else" statement. The PS supposed to fix that.
Also it increases the timeout value.

Change-Id: I284cff06a34ddb864484d2a63780b4fdb9075a0a

commit_message:
Unbreak mock-releated autospec issue

For some reason, in stable/stein and older, the autospec=True in
this test started failing. Using python3's unittest.mock works, so
just to get this working use that if it exists.

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle except
swift and sorlets which is exception approved in this goal.

Somehow this repo is left to remove the py2.7 requirement
and setup.cfg file cleanup.

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Also drop the stable/queens|rocky py2 jobs because octavia-tempest-plugin master
code cannot test them because of py2 drop. They are also Extended Maintainance
state so it is ok to not test them on master. Same way Tempest and other
plugins did
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722183/

Change-Id: I9b20229a25dc9752e4a813709f0b67bbd104faa5

commit_message:
Do not assert heat is not None

There are valid cases where this assertion breaks a deployment.
E.g. running the new ansible-based derived paramters playbook.

Change-Id: I1a50e77479dfe19c7fe1d153330d09515cd12a72

commit_message:
[CI] Convert rally jobs to zuulv3 native

The old/legacy job depends on components
from OpenStack infra that are not maintained
any longer.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 12016, 'name': 'DellEMC PowerMAX CI', 'email': 'emc.vmax.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vmax-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15386, 'name': 'Nexenta CI', 'email': 'openstackci@nexenta.com', 'username': 'nexentaci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 21884, 'name': 'DellEMC Unity CI', 'email': 'emc.unity.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-unity-ci'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25243, 'name': 'NetApp CI', 'username': 'NetApp-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30002, 'name': 'Douglas Viroel', 'email': 'viroel@gmail.com', 'username': 'dviroel'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-28 23:41:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[devstack][ci] Stop requiring g-reg service

When using manila's devstack plugin, we pull down
the latest manila testing image created with the
manila-image-elements project, and upload it to the
stack's Glance/Image service.

Glance's V2 API no longer needs g-reg which was a
legacy database proxy service for the older glance
API. Our devstack plugin should not have a hard
dependency on this service.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/094773.html
[2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/newton/approved/glance/deprecate-registry.html

Change-Id: I58603032fb215ac0be2f76c8cd9fbce775be41dd
Closes-Bug: #1859847

commit_message:
[devstack][ci] Stop requiring g-reg service

When using manila's devstack plugin, we pull down
the latest manila testing image created with the
manila-image-elements project, and upload it to the
stack's Glance/Image service.

Glance's V2 API no longer needs g-reg which was a
legacy database proxy service for the older glance
API. Our devstack plugin should not have a hard
dependency on this service.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/094773.html
[2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/newton/approved/glance/deprecate-registry.html

Change-Id: I58603032fb215ac0be2f76c8cd9fbce775be41dd
Closes-Bug: #1859847

commit_message:
move neutron only common constants to private module

Almost all of neutron.common.constants is rehomed into
neutron_lib.constants now and as per the discussion in [1] it seems
most folks think the remaining constants should stay in neutron as they
are only used internally within neutron.

This patch moves the neutron only neutron.common.constants into a
private neutron.common._constants. The former will be removed once we
consume the final constants from neutron-lib.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/647807/

Change-Id: I2d65f8fcfa08984ccf60c4d023f9a9d72b89d79c
(cherry picked from commit fb6094fe8ddf6e201938c028c4bf29c472e4a465)

subject: Add ignore_errors in the ir plugin playbook
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6683, 'name': 'Pavel Sedlák', 'email': 'psedlak@redhat.com', 'username': 'psedlak'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-29 15:19:20.000000000', 'files': ['infrared_plugin/main.yml'], 'message': "Add ignore_errors in the ir plugin playbook

Plugin's main playbook must continue in execution, no matter what,
so the whole playbook should ignore errors.

More background info: not all tasks of the role are ignoring errors,
which has caused an issue in the situation when the networking got
broken suddenly and ansible lost connection to the nodes while executing
the role -> after the connection got lost, tasks started failing and when
one of the tasks not ignoring errors failed, the whole playbook failed
which resulted in not calling the other half of the plugin's playbook,
which is responsible for publishing ...

Anyway, the role is supposed to gather as much as possible, so no matter
errors, all the tasks within it should be executed.

The patch adds ignore_errors in ir plugin's playbook, which shields
ir plugin from any errors and provides execution of all the tasks when
running the as infrared plugin.

Change-Id: Ib70a4b72fbed2eda730eb279e175107846fffeec
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add ignore_errors in the ir plugin playbook

Plugin's main playbook must continue in execution, no matter what,
so the whole playbook should ignore errors.

More background info: not all tasks of the role are ignoring errors,
which has caused an issue in the situation when the networking got
broken suddenly and ansible lost connection to the nodes while executing
the role -> after the connection got lost, tasks started failing and when
one of the tasks not ignoring errors failed, the whole playbook failed
which resulted in not calling the other half of the plugin's playbook,
which is responsible for publishing ...

Anyway, the role is supposed to gather as much as possible, so no matter
errors, all the tasks within it should be executed.

The patch adds ignore_errors in ir plugin's playbook, which shields
ir plugin from any errors and provides execution of all the tasks when
running the as infrared plugin.

Change-Id: Ib70a4b72fbed2eda730eb279e175107846fffeec

commit_message:
Added fail-safe test about file collection

Assures that the files expected to be collected where indeed
collected.

This should avoid accidental regression where we may wrongly assume
that we collected files or we collected empty files that where
never expected to be empty.

Change-Id: I13717eaa7dbb7dd42569c26d9ad13dbf0d40062f

commit_message:
Check import order

Restore pep 8check for import order.
Set flake8-import-order version to 0.17.1
Full py3 compatible version.
Add all Python3 modules to stdlib list.
Also includes fix to an enum34 dependency bug.

Change-Id: I989a84e362a18225c6f79580b22bb028d3e265ff
